content.title: Tyson Fury vs Deontay Wilder: WBC sanctions rematch between heavyweights after controversial draw - The Independent
content.desc: A rematch between Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder has been sanctioned by the World Boxing Council (WBC) following a championship fight in Los Angeles that ended in a contested draw. The WBC said in a statement that “a direct rematch has been approved” following a unanimous vote of its board of governors. “Wilder and Fury gave boxing one of the best fights in the heavyweight division in a long time, which has created tremendous popular demand for the fans to see a rematch,” it said. It continued: ”I wish to once again congratulate Deontay Wilder and Tyson Fury for their great battle inside the...

content.title: Vasyl Lomachenko Vs. Jose Pedraza: 10 Things You Should Know About Saturday's Fight - Forbes
content.desc: Vasyl Lomachenko (11-1, 9 KO) might be the best boxer in the world. On Saturday night, he’ll try to drive that point home when he defends his WBA Super World Lightweight champion and tries to add the WBO title held by Jose Pedraza (25-1, 12 KO) in the process. OXNARD, CA – APRIL 24: Vasyl Lomachenko works out during a media workout on April 24, 2018 in Oxnard, California. (Photo by Josh Lefkowitz/Getty Images) Unification bouts are great and they can be even better when a fighter of Lomachenko’s ilk are involved. Here are the 10 things you should know about the fight. content.title: Tyson Fury moves step closer to Deontay Wilder rematch after WBC sanctions pair to fight again - The Telegraph
content.desc: The prospect of another fight between Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder moved a step closer on Friday night when the WBC voted unanimously in favour of sanctioning a rematch. Wilder held onto his WBC belt after a controversial split-decision draw when the two men met in the ring last weekend. Both men suggested they would be keen on a rematch and the WBC have now officially sanctioned the fight. The decision means Wilder can now negotiate a second fight with Fury, despite having Dominic Breazeale as mandatory challenger. WBC president Mauricio Sulaiman said: “The World Boxing Council conducted ...

content.title: UFC 231 Full Fight Video: Watch Valentina Shevchenko Submit Priscila Cachoeira - Forbes
content.desc: When Valentina Shevchenko stepped into the octagon at UFC Fight Night 125, she was five months removed from taking UFC women’s bantamweight champion Amanda Nunes to the five-round limit at UFC 215. Shevchenko fell short in her bid to dethrone Nunes, she lost via split decision, but she retained her No. 1 ranking after the defeat. However, when she faced Priscila Cachoeira at UFC Fight Night 125, it was at the 125-pound flyweight limit. Valentina Shevchenko submitted Priscila Cachoeira at UFC Fight Night 125. At UFC 231 Shevchenko faces Joanna Jedrzejczyk for the vacant UFC women’s flyweight...

content.title: Pacquiao Takes Time Out With Chic Angel K-Pop Group - International Business Times
content.desc: It will be a busy December for Filipino boxing champion Manny Pacquiao, who is in the midst of training as he prepares for Adrien "The Problem" Broner. Despite a hectic schedule, the WBA welterweight champion found the time to accommodate a K-Pop group, Chic Angel, who paid a visit to the fighting Senator from Saranggani Province at a local gym. The visit somehow lightened the mood for Pacquiao, according to GMA News Online. The girls watched the Filipino do mitts training and eventually performed inside the ring for the Filipino boxing icon and his friends. The visit was wrapped up with Pa...

content.title: UFC 231 Full Fight Video: Watch Joanna Jedrzejczyk Score A 2015 TKO Victory Over Carla Esparza - Forbes
content.desc: Carla Esparza became the first women’s strawweight champion in December 2014 when she submitted Rose Namajunas to close out season 20 of “The Ultimate Fighter.” Esparza’s first defense of that title came three months later when she faced down Joanna Jedrzejczyk. Joanna Jedrzejczyk defeated Carla Esparza to win the UFC women’s strawweight title at UFC 185. At UFC 231, Jedrzejczyk faces Valentina Shevchenko in a bout that will determine the UFC women’s flyweight champion. (Photo by Ronald Martinez/Getty Images) At the time of the title fight, which served as the co-main event of UFC 185, Jedr...
